The IRS collected: 93 billion more from individual American taxpayers in 2018 compared to 2017, as reported by Yahoo! Finance and based on figures published by the IRS in its 2018 Data Book.
The IRS collected a total of: 1.97 trillion in gross collections for 2018, compared to $1.87 trillion in 2017, indicating an increase in tax revenue.
Refunds for individual taxpayers slightl: 386 billion in 2017 to about $398 billion in 2018.
The additional: 93 billion collected from individual taxpayers in 2018 is close to the amount of tax breaks that corporations received under the 2017 Tax Cuts and Jobs Act (TCJA).
